definition: to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
ancient bronze wine holder with 3 legs and loop handle/nobility

sentences.english: Are you ready to be Knighted?
The queen is going to knight him with the very sword.
sentences.chinese: 女王将用同一把剑为他封爵位。

sentences.english: Seven have been knighted, and one was even a prince.
sentences.chinese: 有7人被封爵，其中一个更是一位王子。

definition: order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
succession/inheritance/hereditary
official ranking/titles and honors
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to win the championship/(of an emperor) to bestow the title of king on a subject
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
feudal fiefdom/land held as a vassal in feudal society/enfeoffment
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
outstanding military service
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
official post
grant of territory by an emperor or monarch (old)
promotion/to take additional post
